properties.name: mt. rushmore
properties.description: Posted by Robin77south dakota Mount Rushmore is a granite mountain carved out to resemble four of the United States president (George Washington, Thomas Jefferson, Theodore Roosevelt, and Abraham Lincoln). The memorial covers 1,278.45 acres. The mountain is located in North Dakota in the Black hills. It is North Dakotas number one tourist attraction. It brings over 2 million people each year.

properties.name: Big Ben
properties.description: Posted by Robin77LondonBig ben is located in Westmister, London. It is the worlds largest chiming clock. The tower is said to be the most popular landmark. The clock is surrounded by TV crews and people to watch the clock strike twelve for the new year.This also happens on Remembrance Day, the chimes of Big Ben are broadcast to mark the 11th hour of the 11th day of the 11th month and the start of two minutes\' silence.

properties.name: Great Wall of China
properties.description: Posted by Robin77ChinaThe great wall of china was originally built to protect the northern borders of the Chinese empire. The wall stretches over 4000 miles it goes from Shanhaiguan in the east and runsto Lop Nur in the west. The majority of the wall is made of stone. At one point the wall was guarded by more than 1 million chinese soldiers. It is estimated that over 3 million chinese died while building the wall.

properties.name: St. Augustine
properties.description: Posted by Robin77Florida

properties.name: Stonehenge
properties.description: Posted by Robin77Stonehenge, EnglandStonehenge is one of the most famous and well known sites in the world. At stonehenge there are several large rocks that are standing in a circular shape.They are said to have been there since 2200B.C.. Stonehenge was not all built at once. There is clear evidence that more was added after the first construction was completed. It is unknown how the stonehenge was created.

properties.name: The Colosseum
properties.description: Posted by Robin77Rome, Italy The Colloseum is a elliptical ampitheatre located in Rome,Italy. The Colosseum was started between 70 and 72 A.D. but was not finished till 80 A.D. under emperor Titus. It was built for gladiator contest. It could seat 50,000 and it was in use for 500 years.During medieval times the Collosseum was converted to a cemetery. Although today the Colosseum is in ruined condition it is still a very popular tourist attraction in Rome.

properties.name: easter island
properties.description: Posted by Robin77easter islandEaster island is one of the Polynesian Islands in the Pacific ocean. The island is most famous for the stone sculptures created by the native Rapanui people. Easter island is one of the most isolated inhabited islands in the world. The closest island to it is 415 km to the east. The name easter island came from a dutch explorer Jacob Roggeveen who discovered the island on easter Sunday 1722. The island consist of three volcanoes that are no longer active.

properties.name: great pyramid
properties.description: Posted by Robin77egyptGiza, the largest of the three pyramids and also the oldest of the three pyramids also known as Khufu\'s pyramid. It is located in Cairo, Egypt. For over 3800 years the great pyramid was the tallest manmade structure. Inside the pyramid are chambers. These chambers include the Kings chamber, the Queens chamber and the unfinished chamber. There are several theories for how the pyramids were built but no one is for sure.

properties.name: liberty bell
properties.description: Posted by Robin77pennsylvaniaThe liberty bell also known as "independence bell" is located in Philidelphia, Pennsylvania. It is one of the most familiar symbols associated with American independence. The most famous ringing of the bell was on July 8 1776 when the bell summoned the citizens of Philadelphia for the reading of the Decleration of Indepedence. Th inscription on the bell reads "Proclaim LIBERTY throughout all the Land unto all the Inhabitants thereof Lev. XXV X By Order of the ASSEMBLY of the Province of PENSYLVANIA for the State House in Philada Pass and Stow Philada MDCCLIII" This is taken out of leviticus 25:10

properties.name: pompeii
properties.description: Posted by Robin77romePompeii was an ancient roman city that was destroyed by a catastrophic eruption of the volcano Mount Vesuvius.The volcano also destroyed Herculaneum. The ash from the volcanoe covered the city and killed all the citizens. The city was lost for over 1700 years. In 1748 it was accidently rediscovered. It has provided many insights to the roman empire. It is know one of the most popular attractions in Italy.
